definition: joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Pennies from heaven, the opportunity came up.
sentences.chinese: 喜從天降，機會突然來了。

sentences.english: The news of my promotion is an unexpected joy.
sentences.chinese: 我獲得提拔的消息真是喜從天降。

sentences.english: It's really a heavensent fortune for me to have been promoted.
sentences.chinese: 我能被提升真是喜從天降。

sentences.english: And when we have unexpected good luck, we often say it came " out of the blue7 ."
sentences.chinese: 當我們有意外的好運時，我們常說喜從天降。
